hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Pairs Mean Reversion on 2.5 Std Dev Spread
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.5 standard deviations from its mean, the spread will revert within 5 trading days with >65% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC-ETH correlation remains high (0.85+) even during NEUTRAL regimes, creating reliable mean reversion opportunities. Extreme deviations typically correct as market participants rebalance large-cap crypto portfolios. The 2.5σ threshold filters noise while capturing meaningful dislocations.
entry_conditions: 20-day rolling z-score of BTC/ETH ratio > +2.5 (short BTC, long ETH)
20-day rolling z-score of BTC/ETH ratio < -2.5 (long BTC, short ETH)
Spread widening occurred over at least 3 consecutive days

exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate < 60% OR average holding period return < 0.8% after accounting for transaction costs and funding rates in NEUTRAL regimes.
